entries.meaning: to be / to exist (inanimate); to have
entries.notes: Godan-pattern in all polite forms (あります, ありません). Irregular in plain negative: ない (not あらない). Used in formal negative copula: ではありません.
From Verb Conjugation sheet.
From Verb Conjugation sheet.
Retroactive addition.
Used when meeting someone for the first time.

entries.surface: よろしくおねがいします
entries.reading: よろしくおねがいします
entries.meaning: pleased to meet you / please take care of me
matches: よろしく おねがいします
entries.notes: Polite greeting used after self-introduction.
Used after the te-form of a verb to make a polite request, e.g. 言ってください (please say).
Loanword from 'personal computer'.
Loanword from English 'bed'.
Loanword from English 'television'.
Loanword from English 'toilet'.
Polite form of 父（ちち）. Uses 父 (N5.1 kanji).
Polite form of 母（はは）. Uses 母 (N5.1 kanji).
Refers to the speaker's own father. Contrast with お父さん (polite/others' father).
Refers to the speaker's own mother. Contrast with お母さん (polite/others' mother).
Standalone noun use of the kanji 人. Contrast with 人々 (hitobito, people in general).
Common adjective meaning 'good' or 'nice'. Irregular conjugation: stems from よ- (e.g. よくない, よかった), not from い-.
Polite name suffix.
First-person singular pronoun. Neutral politeness level suitable for most situations.
Second-person pronoun. Avoid using with superiors; address by name instead.
Polite copula. Attaches to nouns and な-adjectives to form polite statements. E.g. がくせいです (I am a student). Question form: ですか.

Plain (informal) copula. Attaches to nouns and な-adjectives in casual speech. Do NOT use after い-adjectives — い-adjectives stand alone in plain speech. Use だ with friends and family; use です in formal situations.
Interrogative pronoun meaning 'what'. Said 'なに' in isolation and before を/が (e.g. なにを); said 'なん' before です, counters, or の (e.g. なんですか、なん人).
